channel.title: Counterplan
channel.itunes:subtitle: Experiments In Thinking
channel.itunes:author: Elijah Buchanan and Walker Curr
channel.itunes:summary: Discussions about economics, politics, forgein policy, philosophy, government, and more. Done by debaters weekly.
channel.itunes:keywords: politics, economics, philosophy, debate, congress, value for value, value4value, Lightning, Bitcoin, Boost, privacy, government
channel.description: Experiments in thought surrounding politics, economics, and philosophy.

item.title: Insider Trading, An Optional Death Penalty, and Scottish Independence
item.itunes:title: Insider Trading, An Optional Death Penalty, and Scottish Independence
item.itunes:author: Elijah Buchanan, Walker Curr, and James Findlay
item.itunes:subtitle: A Review of the 2023 Congress Debate Season
item.itunes:summary:
Description

Idaho Congress Debate in 2023 was a deeply fascinating scene. We get together with fellow congress debater James Findlay to discuss our favorite bills, why they provided such good debate, and what changes we want to see on the congress scene next year. How do we stop congressmen from trading on insider information? Should a defendant get to decide whether they get a death penalty or life without parole? What is the Jones Act and how does it make stuff more expensive? What is the Scottish Independence movement and should the US support it? Why is unconstitutional legislation such a common mistake in debate? Three congress nerds pick apart these questions and more on Counterplan.

Chapters

(00:00) Intro (00:30) What is Congress Debate? (04:30) Insider Trading & The STOCK Act (11:00) Optional Death Penalty (16:00) A Bill to Repeal The Jones Act (22:30) Discouraging Scottish Independence (33:30) Trends and bills we didn't like (47:00) How to write better bills (53:00) Outro

Contact

Reach out through email or boostagram, and we will read and discuss it on the show. Email: counterplan@proton.me

Value4Value

If you got some value from the show, please consider giving back through a boost. - Install a new podcast app and boost in on the episode page. ...or, if you want to keep your current podcast app - Boost in directly from the Podcast Index • Install Alby • Find Counterplan on the Podcast Index • Boost right from the page!

item.title: A Real World MOP?
item.itunes:title: A Real World MOP?
item.itunes:author: Elijah Buchanan and Walker Curr
item.itunes:subtitle: Could the Mobile Operations Police of Ender's Game work?
item.itunes:summary:
Description

Walker and Elijah discuss the Mobile Operations Police (MOP) of Ender's Game, an international and independent force of elite fighters who fight terrorists and aliens in the books. We investigate how the MOP functioned, what makes it unique from modern day special forces, and what a real world MOP might look like.

Contact

Reach out through email or boostagram, and we will read and discuss it on the show. Email: counterplan@proton.me
